moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. Bf4 e6 3. Nf3 d5 4. e3 Bd6: So far, all pretty normal for a London. Black can do two things: c5, and get countergame on the queenside, or try to castle queenside, instead. Black didn't make the mistake of Nc6 before c5, but castled kingside. This makes it a perfect target for me. It would be exaggerated to say that white has an edge, but black has to play with more care that it seems.
moves.6... a6: ? Just one carelessly slow move. Probably it has a plan of b5-Bb7, but...
moves.7. g4: Here it comes. Cesar crossed the Rubicone.
moves.7... Nc6: Almost useless move. The Nd5 can't be taken by the other N. Nb4 is hardly an annoyance. Black plans to answer Nd7 to g5?
moves.8. g5: Nd7 forces me to find a way to proceed, and I have plenty of them, but it would be hard to find a definitive winning one. But black preferred...
moves.8... Ne4: My Nd2 has only one scope in this opening: to be exchanged with this black N.
moves.9. Bd3: Black is helping, but not all is still done. This move threatens him a pawn. But, more than that, is x-raying h7.
moves.9... Nxg5: ?? The losing mistake. f5 was needed, or even Qh4, and the fight continues.  But now, nothing can save black.
moves.10. Qh5: A piece is lost... or more.
moves.10... h6: Opening a square for his N to retire, but...
moves.11. Rg1: If now black plays 15... f6, 16... BxN. Bxh6 is threatened, so fxB seems the only reasonable option. After it, 17. Ng5 seems to offer white with Nxh6, winning, for example: Be7, 18. Nxh6+, gxN, 19. Qg6+! and mate on h7 the next move.
moves.11... Nxe5: BxN, dxB, Ne7 was another idea.
moves.12. dxe5: The unconfortable Bd6 pays the price of his outcome (it could have been in e7, and black would stand a little better).
moves.12... g6: Ok now. Playing against a 1900+ deserves something more interesting than the boring Qxh6.
moves.13... fxg6 14. Qxg6+ Kh8 15. Qxh6+: And black resigns. It's not only hanging two minor pieces with almost no action, but he's facing a dreadful discovered check after BxN. A good lesson about how very slight careless moves can lead you right into the hell against a London :-D
